summary: This document is a chain of emails between an FBI Special Agent and Southwest Airlines' legal department regarding a federal grand jury subpoena for flight records. The FBI is investigating a child exploitation/human trafficking matter and requests records from 1994-1998 and 2019, with an expedited due date and a non-notification request.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking
persons.context: The FBI agent is the sender/requester of the federal grand jury subpoena to Southwest Airlines for flight records related to a child exploitation/human trafficking investigation.

persons.name: Senior Paralegal, Certified Paralegal Southwest Airlines Co.
persons.context: The Southwest Airlines paralegal is the main point of contact responding to the FBI's subpoena, providing updates on document production and stating that records from 1994-1998 are not available.

persons.name: Subpoena Research Specialist
persons.context: Mentioned by the Southwest paralegal as the person who can provide an expected production date for the subpoenaed records.

connections.person1: Special Agent FBI New York Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking
connections.person2: Senior Paralegal, Certified Paralegal Southwest Airlines Co.
connections.description: The FBI agent is issuing a federal grand jury subpoena to the Southwest Airlines paralegal to obtain flight records for an investigation.

connections.person1: Senior Paralegal, Certified Paralegal Southwest Airlines Co.
connections.description: The paralegal copies the specialist to provide the FBI with an expected production date for the subpoenaed records.

events.title: FBI Serves Subpoena to Southwest Airlines
events.description: An FBI Special Agent sends a federal grand jury subpoena to Southwest Airlines requesting flight records for 1994-1998 and 2019, with an expedited due date of February 7, 2020.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking

events.title: Southwest Sends Initial Responsive Documents
events.description: Southwest Airlines' legal department sends an initial set of responsive documents to the FBI in response to the subpoena.
personsInvolved: Senior Paralegal, Certified Paralegal Southwest Airlines Co.

events.title: Southwest Informs FBI of Record Limitations
events.description: A Southwest paralegal informs the FBI that their records do not go back to 1994-1998, but they can provide 2019 records, typically within 30 business days.
personsInvolved: Senior Paralegal, Certified Paralegal Southwest Airlines Co.
Special Agent FBI New York Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking

keyFacts: The FBI served a federal grand jury subpoena on Southwest Airlines at the end of January 2020 as part of a child exploitation/human trafficking investigation.
The subpoena specifically requested flight records from 1994-1998 and 2019, indicating the investigation spans a long period.
Southwest Airlines informed the FBI that their records do not go back to 1994-1998, but they could provide 2019 records.
The FBI requested that Southwest Airlines not notify the subscriber of the records, highlighting the sensitive and confidential nature of the investigation.
The correspondence shows the FBI's urgency, with an initial expedited due date of February 7, 2020, and follow-up requests for status updates.
